trial_identification.studytitle: Comparison of fasting glucose and oral glucose tolerance testing to screen for diabetes mellitus in subjects on long-term glucocorticoid therapy
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Comparison of fasting glucose and oral glucose tolerance testing to screen for diabetes mellitus in subjects on long-term glucocorticoid therapy

conditions.healthcondition: Risk of diabetes in subjects receiving long-term glucocorticoid therapy

interventions.interventions: Oral glucose tolerance test: This involves a blood test to measure plasma glucose fasting and 2 hours after a 75 g glucose drink. The test takes two hours.
interventions.comparator: Subjects with rheumatologic disease not on glucocorticoids

primaryOutcome.outcome: Sensitivity of fasting glucose to determine diabetes
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At the end of the 12 month study period.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: At the end of the 12 month study period.

eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Type 1 diabetes mellitus Active inflammatory disease (defined as clinical evidence of active synovitis, elevated C-reactive protein (CRP) or recent intensification of immunosuppressive therapy) Significant hepatic (AST or ALT > 3 times upper limit of normal) or renal (serum creatinine > 200Âµmol/L) dysfunction

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The primary purpose of this study is to determine the prevalence of diabetes in subjects on long-term glucocorticoid (steroid) therapy and the best way to diagnose diabetes in this patient group.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Burt MG, Willenberg VM, Petersons CJ, Smith MD, Ahern MJ, Stranks SN. Screening for diabetes in patients with inflammatory rheumatologic disease administered long-term prednisolone: A cross-sectional study. Rheumatology 2012;51:1112-1119
